description:
Tick and flea control without harsh chemicals

Our easy-to-use tick control formula fights pests by working with nature—and without all the toxic, hard-to-pronounce ingredients. Concentrated cedar oil kills existing ticks and their larvae, and kills fleas and mosquitoes on contact for up to 4 weeks in dry areas. Smells like a walk in the woods!

sections.faq:
When should I see results?
This biodegradable product is an effective repellent for common tick populations, with best results after continued application. If you’ve only applied one treatment, we suggest an extra bumper application before continuing the best practices listed on the package.
How often should I apply it?
Apply twice within 7 days to kick start pest reduction, then every 30 days after that for best results.
How many square feet does one bottle cover?
Up to 5,000 sq. ft.
How do I apply it?
Spray in an up and down motion, working quickly to cover your protected lawn area, trees, mulch, and bushes until all foliage is just fully wet.
Should I use Nix Ticks before or after Sunday nutrients?
You can apply either one first—the order is totally up to you! Regardless, you’ll want to wait 24 hours between those applications to avoid washing out or diluting either formula.
Are there any US states or territories where Nix Ticks is not approved for use?
Nix Ticks is not yet approved for use in the following states and territories: AS, DC, GU, ID, IN, MD, ME, MP, MS, MT, PR, SD, VI.
